title.native: カーニバル・ファンタズム

description:
Carnival Phantasm is an adaption of the manga "Take Moon" by Type-Moon's Eri Takenashi, to celebrate Type-Moon's 10th Anniversary.

Carnival Phantasm shows parodies and new stories loosely based on Type-Moon's original works like Melty Blood, Fate/Stay Night, Tsukihime, and more.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Succubus
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a succubus, a creature in medieval folklore that typically uses their sexual prowess to trap and seduce people to feed off them.

node.description:
__[Website](https://coorie.futureartist.net/) | [Profile (Peak A Soul)](https://www.peakasoul.net/coorie) | [Blog (JP)](https://rinocoorie.exblog.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rino_CooRie)__

__Rino__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and composer. She used to be a part of the two-piece unit [CooRie](https://anilist.co/staff/101323) alongside Naoyuki Osada between 2002 and 2003, which is when Osada formally left the unit. Rino would go on to continue the music unit under the same name, but now as a solo unit, and as the sole member. She mostly composes under the name CooRie, but will sometimes be credited under her own name instead.

_(Not to be confused with the voice actress [Rino](https://anilist.co/staff/189936))_

__Headquarters:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Website](http://typemoon.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tmitterofficial)__

__Introduction:__
Type-Moon is a Japanese game company was founded by artist [Takashi Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99054/Takashi-Takeuchi) and writer [Kinoko Nasu](https://anilist.co/staff/98250/Kinoko-Nasu), who were also schoolmates. The names "TYPE-MOON" and "Notes." come from one of their early works, Notes..

__History:__
Originally formed as a Doujin Soft in 2000 and created the popular visual novel Tsukihime, but turned into a Commercial Organization on January 30, 2004 and in the same year, they released their PC-based eroge visual novel game Fate/stay night, which is their most well known title.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/takenashinote) | [Website](http://takenote.xsrv.jp/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=370481)

Part of the game company and former doujinshi circle [TYPE-MOON](https://anilist.co/staff/97582) and younger sister of [Shinichi Yuuki](https://anilist.co/staff/100211).

Eri Takenashi is the original author of the Kannagi manga. She has a few cameo appearances in several episodes of the Kannagi anime, such as ep. 5.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nassy_takanashi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nassy_takanashi/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/64mecceQewFCKwCK6JBW0o)
Hobbies:  Driving Listening to music Taking walks Watching movies Skills & Abilities:  Dance Skipping rope

[Website](https://endoh-masaaki.com/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCBnCeOigma9Cv6eI5_QleQQ) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/遠藤正明) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masaaki_Endoh)

Masaaki Endou is a Japanese singer-songwriter who is prominent in the area of soundtracks for anime and tokusatsu productions. He is one of the founders of the Anison band JAM Project and has been a regular member ever since its inception in 2000. His nickname is the "Young Lion of Anison" and he goes by the motto "Always Full Voice".
[Website](https://www.peakasoul.net/yozuca) | [Blog](https://blog.excite.co.jp/yozublog/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yozuca_astrsk)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/faylan/)

Before she was signed with Lantis, she had released one single under Hobirecords.  
Non-anime singles:  "Gekka no Rasen" - PC game Touka Gettan ED "Never Slash!!" - PC game "Gakuto!" theme song "Reconquista" - PC game "Reconquista" theme song "conspire" - PC game Valkyrie Complex insert song "Soukyuu no Hikari" - BlazBlue Continuum Shift Extend opening song (PS3/360)

**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan
**Graduated:** Aichi Institute of Technology

**[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/masatomo-ota/)** | **[Artist Profile (First Call Music)](https://firstcallmusic.net/artist/%e5%a4%aa%e7%94%b0%e9%9b%85%e5%8f%8b/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masatomoota)**

**Masatomo Oota** is a Japanese guitarist and musician, who does composition and arrangement for anime. He is a part of the two-piece music unit [SCREEN mode](https://anilist.co/staff/119992/SCREEN-mode), and has been since 2013.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/soft_okuda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/奥田維城)

Affiliated with Swara Pro.

**Residency:** Tokyo, Japan
**Graduated:** Aichi Institute of Technology

**[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/masatomo-ota/)** | **[Artist Profile (First Call Music)](https://firstcallmusic.net/artist/%e5%a4%aa%e7%94%b0%e9%9b%85%e5%8f%8b/)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masatomoota)**

**Masatomo Oota** is a Japanese guitarist and musician, who does composition and arrangement for anime. He is a part of the two-piece music unit [SCREEN mode](https://anilist.co/staff/119992/SCREEN-mode), and has been since 2013.

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

Her involvement in the game and anime Kimi ga Nozomu Eien, where she voiced the role of one of the heroines, Haruka Suzumiya and performed and penned the theme songs and other songs relating to the series, has brought her much attention. Her single "Precious Memories", used as the opening theme song for the series' animated version was a success; it had a peak ranking of 17th place on the Oricon charts and charted for 13 weeks.[1] She has since performed songs for other games and anime, including series such as Muv-Luv, Chrono Crusade, My-HiME, My-Otome, and School Days.    Kuribayashi has performed as part of the group Wild 3nin Musume, whose other present members are Joy Max (a.k.a. Joy Max Maximum) and Kisho Taniyama (a.k.a. Jackie Yang). She also once paired with Chiaki Takahashi to form the group exige, where Takahashi was known as CT. Veronica.(From Wiki)
